Templates.name: sap.ushell.System
Templates.constructorDescription: Constructs a new system object representing a system used in the Unified Shell.

Templates.template:
addBookmark(
	{
		title: "${title}", // string
		url: "${url}", // string
		icon: "${icon}", // string
		info: "${info}", // string
		subtitle: "${subtitle}", // string
		serviceUrl: "${serviceUrl}", // string
		serviceRefreshInterval: "${serviceRefreshInterval}", // string
		numberUnit: "${numberUnit}" // string
	},
	"${oGroup}" // object
)
Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.addBookmark
Templates.helpDescription: Adds a bookmark tile to one of the user's home page groups.

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.addCatalogTileToGroup
Templates.helpDescription: Adds the catalog tile with the given ID to given group. The catalog tile is looked up in the legacy SAP HANA catalog unless data to look up a remote catalog is provided.

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Container.setLogonFrameProvider
Templates.helpDescription:
Determines the current logon frame provider for the entire Unified Shell. Initially, a rudimentary default provider is active and should be replaced as soon as possible by the current renderer. A logon frame provider is used to facilitate user authentication even for requests sent via XMLHttpRequest. It is called back in order to create a hidden IFRAME, to show it to the user, then to hide and destroy it. The frame must be treated as a black box by the provider; especially with respect to the source of the frame which is managed by the Unified Shell framework. Showing the frame might require user interaction and some decoration around the frame. The frame should be destroyed, not reused, to be on the safe side. Note that in typical cases with SAML2, authentication happens automatically and the frame can stay hidden. The following order of method calls is guaranteed:
  1. The create method is called first.
  2. The show method may be called next (if there is HTML code to display).
  3. The destroy method is called last.
  4. A new cycle may start for a new logon process.

Templates.template:
new sap.ushell.ui.appfinder.AppBox(
	"${sId}", // string
	{
		id: ${id}, // sap.ui.core.ID
		models: ${models}, // object
		bindingContexts: ${bindingContexts}, // object
		objectBindings: ${objectBindings}, // object
		metadataContexts: ${metadataContexts}, // object
		validationSuccess: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		validationError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		parseError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		formatError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		modelContextChange: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tooltip: ${tooltip}, // sap.ui.core.TooltipBase
		customData: [${customData}], // sap.ui.core.CustomData[]
		layoutData: ${layoutData}, // sap.ui.core.LayoutData
		dependents: [${dependents}], // sap.ui.core.Element[]
		dragDropConfig: [${dragDropConfig}], // sap.ui.core.dnd.DragDropBase[]
		blocked: ${bBlocked}, // boolean
		busy: ${bBusy}, // boolean
		busyIndicatorDelay: ${1000}, // int
		busyIndicatorSize: ${sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium}, // sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize
		visible: ${bVisible}, // boolean
		fieldGroupIds: ${[]}, // string[]
		validateFieldGroup: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		title: "${title}", // string
		subtitle: "${subtitle}", // string
		icon: "${icon}", // string
		url: "${url}", // string
		navigationMode: "${navigationMode}", // string
		pinButton: ${pinButton}, // sap.m.Button
		press: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		afterRendering: [function (oEvent) {}, this] // function|array
	}
)
Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui/appfinder/AppBox. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getSubtitle subtitle} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : string
    • {@link #getUrl url} : string
    • {@link #getNavigationMode navigationMode} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPinButton pinButton} : sap.m.Button
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterRendering afterRendering} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.ui.appfinder.AppBox
Templates.helpDescription: Add your documentation for the newui/appfinder/AppBox

		text: ${""}, // string

	}
)
Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui/footerbar/AddBookmarkButton. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getBeforePressHandler beforePressHandler} : any
    • {@link #getAfterPressHandler afterPressHandler} : any
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getSubtitle subtitle} : string
    • {@link #getInfo info} : string
    • {@link #getTileIcon tileIcon} : string
    • {@link #getNumberUnit numberUnit} : string
    • {@link #getKeywords keywords} : string
    • {@link #getCustomUrl customUrl} : any
    • {@link #getServiceUrl serviceUrl} : any
    • {@link #getServiceRefreshInterval serviceRefreshInterval} : string
    • {@link #getShowGroupSelection showGroupSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAppData appData} : object
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Button#constructor sap.m.Button} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.ui.footerbar.AddBookmarkButton
Templates.helpDescription: A button to be displayed in the application footer. Clicking the button opens a dialog box allowing the user to save the app state, so that the app can be launched in this state directly from the launchpad.

Templates.template:
new sap.ushell.ui.launchpad.GridContainer(
	"${sId}", // string
	{
		id: ${id}, // sap.ui.core.ID
		models: ${models}, // object
		bindingContexts: ${bindingContexts}, // object
		objectBindings: ${objectBindings}, // object
		metadataContexts: ${metadataContexts}, // object

		validationError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		parseError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		formatError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		modelContextChange: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tooltip: ${tooltip}, // sap.ui.core.TooltipBase
		customData: [${customData}], // sap.ui.core.CustomData[]
		layoutData: ${layoutData}, // sap.ui.core.LayoutData
		dependents: [${dependents}], // sap.ui.core.Element[]
		dragDropConfig: [${dragDropConfig}], // sap.ui.core.dnd.DragDropBase[]
		blocked: ${bBlocked}, // boolean
		busy: ${bBusy}, // boolean
		busyIndicatorDelay: ${1000}, // int
		busyIndicatorSize: ${sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium}, // sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize
		visible: ${bVisible}, // boolean
		fieldGroupIds: ${[]}, // string[]
		validateFieldGroup: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		groupId: "${groupId}", // string
		showHeader: ${bShowHeader}, // boolean
		defaultGroup: ${bDefaultGroup}, // boolean
		isLastGroup: ${bIsLastGroup}, // boolean
		headerText: "${headerText}", // string
		headerLevel: ${sap.m.HeaderLevel.H2}, // sap.m.HeaderLevel
		groupHeaderLevel: ${sap.m.HeaderLevel.H4}, // sap.m.HeaderLevel
		showGroupHeader: ${bShowGroupHeader}, // boolean
		homePageGroupDisplay: "${homePageGroupDisplay}", // string
		isGroupLocked: ${bIsGroupLocked}, // boolean
		isGroupSelected: ${bIsGroupSelected}, // boolean
		editMode: ${bEditMode}, // boolean
		showBackground: ${bShowBackground}, // boolean
		icon: ${"sap-icon://locked"}, // string
		showIcon: ${bShowIcon}, // boolean
		enableHelp: ${bEnableHelp}, // boolean
		tileActionModeActive: ${bTileActionModeActive}, // boolean
		ieHtml5DnD: ${bIeHtml5DnD}, // boolean
		showEmptyLinksArea: ${bShowEmptyLinksArea}, // boolean
		showEmptyLinksAreaPlaceHolder: ${bShowEmptyLinksAreaPlaceHolder}, // boolean
		supportLinkPersonalization: ${bSupportLinkPersonalization}, // boolean
		tileSizeBehavior: ${"TILE_SIZE_BEHAVIOR.RESPONSIVE"}, // string
		tiles: [${tiles}], // sap.ui.core.Control[]
		links: [${links}], // sap.ui.core.Control[]
		beforeContent: [${beforeContent}], // sap.ui.core.Control[]
		afterContent: [${afterContent}], // sap.ui.core.Control[]
		footerContent: [${footerContent}], // sap.ui.core.Control[]
		headerActions: [${headerActions}], // sap.ui.core.Control[]
		afterRendering: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		titleChange: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tileDragStart: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tileDragEnter: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tileDrop: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		layoutChange: [function (oEvent) {}, this] // function|array
	}
)
Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap/ushell/ui/launchpad/GridContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getGroupId groupId} : string
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDefaultGroup defaultGroup} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsLastGroup isLastGroup} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHeaderText headerText} : string
    • {@link #getHeaderLevel headerLevel} : sap.m.HeaderLevel (default: H2)
    • {@link #getGroupHeaderLevel groupHeaderLevel} : sap.m.HeaderLevel (default: H4)
    • {@link #getShowGroupHeader showGroupHeader} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHomePageGroupDisplay homePageGroupDisplay} : string
    • {@link #getIsGroupLocked isGroupLocked} : boolean
    • {@link #getIsGroupSelected isGroupSelected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEditMode editMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowBackground showBackground} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : string (default: sap-icon://locked)
    • {@link #getShowIcon showIcon} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableHelp enableHelp} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTileActionModeActive tileActionModeActive} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIeHtml5DnD ieHtml5DnD} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEmptyLinksArea showEmptyLinksArea} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEmptyLinksAreaPlaceHolder showEmptyLinksAreaPlaceHolder} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSupportLinkPersonalization supportLinkPersonalization} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTileSizeBehavior tileSizeBehavior} : string (default: TILE_SIZE_BEHAVIOR.RESPONSIVE)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTiles tiles} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getLinks links} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getBeforeContent beforeContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getAfterContent afterContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getFooterContent footerContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getHeaderActions headerActions} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:afterRendering afterRendering} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:titleChange titleChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tileDragStart tileDragStart} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tileDragEnter tileDragEnter} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tileDrop tileDrop} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:layoutChange layoutChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.ui.launchpad.GridContainer
Templates.helpDescription: A container that arranges Tile and Card controls.

Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui/launchpad/ShortcutsHelpContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Element[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.ui.launchpad.ShortcutsHelpContainer
Templates.helpDescription: A container that arranges the helper for shortcuts (open by ctrl+f1).

Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ToolAreaItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getAriaLabel ariaLabel} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getExpandable expandable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:expand expand} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.ui.shell.ToolAreaItem
Templates.helpDescription: A control to be placed in the tool area

Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new components/factsheet/controls/PictureTile. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 32px)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 32px)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getTileContent tileContent} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureViewerItem)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pictureDelete pictureDelete} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.CustomTile#constructor sap.m.CustomTile} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureTile
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
Tile control embedding an image and allowing custom sizing

DeprecatedInfo.description: PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.

		tileMove: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tileDelete: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tileAdd: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tileScaling: ${0.95}, // float
		removable: ${bRemovable}, // boolean
		items: [${items}], // sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureViewerItem[]
		pictureDeleted: [function (oEvent) {}, this] // function|array
	}
)
Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new components/factsheet/controls/PictureViewer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTileScaling tileScaling} : float (default: 0.95)
    • {@link #getRemovable removable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureViewerItem[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pictureDeleted pictureDeleted} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.TileContainer#constructor sap.m.TileContainer} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureViewer
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 PictureViewer was replacing the Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
Picture viewer control relying on the TileContainer control

DeprecatedInfo.description: PictureViewer was replacing the Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.

Templates.template:
new sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureViewerItem(
	"${sId}", // string
	{
		id: ${id}, // sap.ui.core.ID
		models: ${models}, // object
		bindingContexts: ${bindingContexts}, // object
		objectBindings: ${objectBindings}, // object
		metadataContexts: ${metadataContexts}, // object
		validationSuccess: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		validationError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		parseError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		formatError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		modelContextChange: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tooltip: ${tooltip}, // sap.ui.core.TooltipBase
		customData: [${customData}], // sap.ui.core.CustomData[]
		layoutData: ${layoutData}, // sap.ui.core.LayoutData
		dependents: [${dependents}], // sap.ui.core.Element[]
		dragDropConfig: [${dragDropConfig}], // sap.ui.core.dnd.DragDropBase[]
		blocked: ${bBlocked}, // boolean
		busy: ${bBusy}, // boolean
		busyIndicatorDelay: ${1000}, // int
		busyIndicatorSize: ${sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium}, // sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize
		visible: ${bVisible}, // boolean
		fieldGroupIds: ${[]}, // string[]
		validateFieldGroup: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		src: "${src}", // string
		image: ${image} // sap.m.Image
	}
)

Constructor for a new components/factsheet/controls/PictureViewerItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSrc src} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getImage image} : sap.m.Image
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureViewerItem
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 PictureViewerItem is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
Picture viewer control relying on the TileContainer control
